org.apache.freemarker.core.model

Class ArgumentArrayLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.freemarker.core.model.ArgumentArrayLayout

  • public final class ArgumentArrayLayout
extends Object
    TemplateCallableModel subinterfaces define a method called execute, which has an argument array parameter, whose layout this class describes. The layout specifies the (minimum) array length, what's the index of which parameters, and if there are varargs parameters, in which case they must not be left null. (Note that a TemplateCallableModel may have null layout; see the documentation of execute for more.)

    Each parameter has a constant index in this array, which is the same for all invocations of the same TemplateCallableModel object (regardless if there are omitted optional parameters). Thus, the argument values can always be accessed at these constant indexes; no runtime name lookup is needed inside the execute method of the TemplateCallableModel implementation. The ArgumentArrayLayout object is usually stored in a static final field of the TemplateCallableModel implementation class. Said constant indexes are alsi usually defined in the TemplateCallableModel implementation as static final constants (then feed into the ArgumentArrayLayout). Some TemplateCallableModel implementations, such those stand for macros and functions defined in the template, decide the layout on runtime instead. Note the less, once the TemplateCallableModel was crated, the layout is fixed.

    The layout of the array is as follows:

    1. getPredefinedPositionalArgumentCount() elements for the predefined positional parameters. Index 0 corresponds to the 1st positional parameter, index 1 for the second, etc. For omitted parameters (optional parameters usually) the corresponding array element is null.
    2. getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap().size() elements for the predefined named arguments. These are at the indexes returned by getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap().get(String name). Yet again, for omitted arguments the corresponding array element is null. Within this index range reserved for the named arguments, the TemplateCallableModel object is free to chose what index belongs to which name (as far as two names don't share the same index).
    3. If there's a positional varargs argument, then 1 element for the positional varargs parameter (whose value will be a TemplateSequenceModel), at index getPositionalVarargsArgumentIndex(). This must not be left null in the argument array. In case there are 0 positional varargs, the caller must set it to an empty TemplateSequenceModel (like TemplateSequenceModel.EMPTY_SEQUENCE).
    4. If there's a named varargs argument, then 1 element for the positional varargs parameter (whose value will be a TemplateHashModelEx2), at index getNamedVarargsArgumentIndex(). This must not be left null in the argument array. In case there are 0 named varargs, the caller must set it to an empty TemplateHashModelEx2 (like TemplateHashModel.EMPTY_HASH).

    The length of the argument array (allocated by the caller of execute) is getTotalLength()}, or more (in case you have a longer array for reuse), in which case the extra elements should be ignored by the callee.

    Instances of this class are immutable, thread-safe objects.

    • Field Detail

      • PARAMETERLESS

        public static final ArgumentArrayLayout PARAMETERLESS
        Constant to be used when the TemplateCallableModel has no parameters.

      • SINGLE_POSITIONAL_PARAMETER

        public static final ArgumentArrayLayout SINGLE_POSITIONAL_PARAMETER
        Constant to be used when the TemplateCallableModel has 1 positional parameter, and no others. (The argument array index of the single positional parameter will be 0.)

      • TWO_POSITIONAL_PARAMETERS

        public static final ArgumentArrayLayout TWO_POSITIONAL_PARAMETERS
        Constant to be used when the TemplateCallableModel has 2 positional parameter, and no others. (The argument array index of the positional parameters will be 0 and 1.)

      • THREE_POSITIONAL_PARAMETERS

        public static final ArgumentArrayLayout THREE_POSITIONAL_PARAMETERS
        Constant to be used when the TemplateCallableModel has 3 positional parameter, and no others. (The argument array index of the positional parameters will be 0, 1, and 2.)

      • POSITIONAL_VARARGS_PARAMETER_ONLY

        public static final ArgumentArrayLayout POSITIONAL_VARARGS_PARAMETER_ONLY
        Constant to be used when the TemplateCallableModel has 1 positional varargs parameter, and no others. (The argument array index of the positional varargs parameter will be 0.)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static ArgumentArrayLayout create(int predefinedPositionalArgumentCount,
                                         boolean hasPositionalVarargsArgument,
                                         StringToIndexMap predefinedNamedArgumentsMap,
                                         boolean hasNamedVarargsArgument)
        Creates a new instance, or returns some of the equivalent static constants (for example PARAMETERLESS).
        Parameters:
        predefinedPositionalArgumentCount - The highest allowed number of positional arguments, not counting the positional varargs argument. The actual positional argument count can be less than this if there are optional positional argument. When calling the execute method of the TemplateCallableModel, this many items will be reserved for the positional arguments in the argument array (not counting the item for the positional varargs argument, if there's one). Positional arguments above this count will go to the varargs argument (if there's one, otherwise it's an error).
        hasPositionalVarargsArgument - Specifies if there's a varargs argument into which positional arguments that aren't predefined are collected
        predefinedNamedArgumentsMap - The valid names for named arguments (not counting named varargs arguments), and their indexes in the argument array passed to the execute method of the TemplateCallableModel. Can be null, which is equivalent to StringToIndexMap.EMPTY. Indexes must fall into the range starting with predefinedPositionalArgumentCount (inclusive), and ending with predefinedPositionalArgumentCount+ predefinedNamedArgumentsMap.size() (exclusive). If not, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. (As ArgumentArrayLayout-s are normally created during class initialization, such an exception will later cause NoClassDefFoundError "Could not initialize" exceptions every time you try to access the class, which are not very informative. Only for the first access of the class will you get an ExceptionInInitializerError with the IllegalArgumentException as its cause exception, which contains the error details.)
        hasNamedVarargsArgument - Specifies if there's a varargs argument into which named arguments that aren't predefined are collected
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the predefinedNamedArgumentsMap contains indexes that are out of range. See the documentation of that parameter for more.

      • getPredefinedPositionalArgumentCount

        public int getPredefinedPositionalArgumentCount()
        See the related parameter of create(int, boolean, StringToIndexMap, boolean).

      • getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap

        public StringToIndexMap getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap()
        See the related parameter of create(int, boolean, StringToIndexMap, boolean).

      • getPositionalVarargsArgumentIndex

        public int getPositionalVarargsArgumentIndex()
        Returns the index of the varargs argument into which positional arguments that aren't predefined are collected, or -1 if there's no such varargs argument. The value of the positional varargs argument is a TemplateSequenceModel that collects all positional arguments whose index would be greater than or equal to getPredefinedPositionalArgumentCount(). The value of this argument can't be null.
        Returns:
        -1 if there's no positional varargs argument

      • getNamedVarargsArgumentIndex

        public int getNamedVarargsArgumentIndex()
        Returns the index of the varargs argument into which named arguments that aren't predefined (via getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap()) are collected, or -1 if there's no such varargs argument. The value of the named varargs argument is a TemplateHashModelEx2 with string keys that collects all the named arguments that aren't present in the getPredefinedNamedArgumentsMap(). The iteration order of this hash corresponds to the order in which the arguments were specified on the call site (in a template, typically). The value of this argument can't be null.
        Returns:
        -1 if there's no named varargs argument

      • getTotalLength

        public int getTotalLength()
        Returns the required (minimum) length of the args array that's passed to the execute method of the TemplateCallableModel subinterface. As there's an index reserved for each predefined parameters (and a varargs parameter always counts as 1 parameter), this length always includes the space reserved for optional parameters as well; it's not why it's said to be a minimum length. It's a minimum length because a longer array might be reused for better performance (but execute should never read those excess elements).

      • isPositionalParametersSupported

        public boolean isPositionalParametersSupported()
        Tells if there can be any positional parameters (predefined or varargs).

      • isNamedParametersSupported

        public boolean isNamedParametersSupported()
        Tells if there can be any named parameters (predefined or varargs).
